Belgia 1589 26 Decem
b
To M
r
Secretary from M
r
Bodly
It may please yo
r
H. to understand, that
sins the deliverie of my former letters to this
bearer, who had no meanes to depart, by reason
of
e frost, I have dealth w
t
e
Generall states
about
e affaires of
Ostend,
and have advertised
my
LL.
of their Answear, wherof I send yo
r
H.
the copie, and of mine owne Proposition and
Replie, which if yo
r
H. see requisit, I beseche
yo
w
to deliver. There was a motion
made of late by
Count Maurice
, that there might
be some fortification in
e litle Ile of
Biervliet
adjoining to
Walcheren,
where it is founde by
triall that
e water there, uppon
e coast of
Flanders,
bearing 14
foot
depth, will harbour at
e lest 200
great shippes: whiche would be a fitte retrait
for an other Spanishe Fleete, and also a commo-
dious haven for many of
e Enemies purposes in
these contreis: considering
at at
Hendoncke
and
other frontier places on Flanders side, there may
be artillerie planted, and sufficient blockhouses
made for
e savegard of their shippes. There
hath bin good c
o
ference uppon it, and it is
thought a needfull worke, but
at they are trobled
by whome
e charge should be borne. Howbeit
I thinke in
e end it will falle to
Zeland
to
disbourse
e mony for
e time, to be deducted
afterwardes uppon their extraordinary contribu-
tions. &c.
